My CV
More About Me

Hi, This is Jingwei! I am a senior student from the School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering (SEIEE), Shanghai Jiao Tong University (SJTU). I am a member of Zhiyuan Honors Program of Engineering, an elite student program affiliated to Zhiyuan College, SJTU. I am also a research intern of music at New York University Shanghai under the supervision of Professor Gus Xia.

I am broadly interested in the computer music field, and my ultimate goal is to contribute to artificial music intelligence which renders better experience in creating, enjoying, and interacting with music. I have been engaged in several projects w.r.t. visiual and auditory perceptual problems, music interaction with robotics, deep music generation, etc. Currently, I am focusing on real-time impovisational accompaniment. See my projects here.

Besides research, I am a professional accordion player with 15 years of performance experience. I am also a Bass singer of SJTU Student Chior and a member of Shanghai Computer Music Association (SCMA).

Projects

Automatic Accompaniment
Category
Try

Dance Generation and Control of Humanoid Robot Over Online Music
Project
Dance Robot

    • In this project, we extract 3D pose of solo dancers from dance videos we collected from the internet and cut them into primitive units w.r.t. the beat sequence of its background music;
    • We generate improvisational dance with unit selection methodology based on two criterion:
      • Symantic relevance of dance units;
      • Stability of the robot when it transitions from one unit to another.
    • The chosen units are mapped to Nao's joint space and a PID controller is applied to synchronize Nao's dance with online music stimulation.

Look&Listen: Mutual Attention between Visual and Auditory Sensory
Project
Look and Listen

    • We focus on mining the inter-relationship between the audio flow and the image flow of videos, and test the capability of our model on the Video Action Recognition task;
    • For each sample of image frame, we sample the 1s audio clip centered by the image and apply STFT to obtain the Mel-spectrogram;
    • We model the relationship between the image flow and the audio flow (in Mel-spectrom) with scaled dot-production attention, the result of which is processed with Psedo-3D network for classification
    • Higher classification accuracy is expected.

Publication

Liu, Chenzhengyi, Jingwei Zhao, Guohang Liu, Yuanning Gao, and Xiaofeng Gao. "D 2 EA: Depict the Epidemic Picture of COVID-19." Journal of Shanghai Jiaotong University (Science) 25 (2020): 165-176. (Equally Contributed)
